definitions.definition: In various religions, a place of torment where some or all evil spirits are believed to go after death.
(in many religions, uncountable) The place where sinners suffer after death.
(countable, hyperbolic, figuratively) A place or situation of great suffering in life.
definitions.example: My new boss is making my job a hell.
You don’t have a snowball's chance in hell.

definitions.definition: (sometimes considered vulgar) Used as an intensifier in phrases grammatically requiring a noun.
definitions.example: I’m as mad as hell and I’m not going to take it any more.

definitions.definition: (obsolete) A place into which a tailor throws shreds, or a printer discards broken type.
In certain games of chase, a place to which those who are caught are carried for detention.
(impolite, sometimes considered vulgar) Used to express discontent, unhappiness, or anger.
definitions.example: Oh, hell! I got another parking ticket.

definitions.definition: (impolite, sometimes considered vulgar) Used to emphasize.
(impolite, sometimes considered vulgar) Used to introduce an intensified statement following an understated one; nay; not only that, but.
definitions.example: [Do it, or, r]est assured, there will be no more Middle Eastern crisis – hell, there will be no more Middle East!

definitions.definition: (postpositional) Alternative form of the hell or like hell.
(rare, metal-working) To add luster to, burnish (silver or gold).
